StoryText:
Jim Irsay, the owner of the Indianapolis Colts, has sadly passed away at the age of 65. He took over the team in 1997, inheriting a franchise with a rich history.
But who was Jim Irsay and why does this matter? He wasn't just an owner; he was a passionate fan who revitalized the Colts. After moving the team to Indianapolis in 1984, he helped build a winning culture, culminating in their Super Bowl XLI victory in 2007.
Did you know he previously served as the Colts’ vice president and general manager for over a decade before becoming owner? He was deeply involved in all aspects of the team.
This is a significant loss for the NFL and the city of Indianapolis. Irsay's impact extended beyond football, as he was a noted collector of musical instruments and a philanthropist. His legacy will undoubtedly be remembered for years to come.

StoryText:

What happened? Ahead of the race, two of their cars failed technical inspection. It turned out some parts weren’t approved for use, a serious rule violation.
What it means is Roger Penske, the team owner, is making it clear: winning isn’t everything – following the rules is paramount. This is a big deal because Team Penske is one of the most successful teams in IndyCar history, and this shows they won’t compromise on integrity.
